data.body: Since it's confusing if one of the statements contains python code.

data.title: selected items in launcher are not displayed/invisible
data.body:
in this screenshot I have selected the tutorial project but as you can (not) see it's not displayed:
![renpy_menudisplaybug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2658281/8270092/bdbbeaee-17cc-11e5-8cee-ef818028a9e6.png)
It does the same for language choice in the launcher preferences.

I thought it was a problem with the update, there was indeed a problem with replacing a font file (Roboto-Light.ttf, the update logfile had a traceback mentioning not being able to replace the file since it was opened by something else) but replacing manually didn't solve the issue.

data.title: Offer to recompile script on build.
'area' property no longer works in 'screen' object since 6.17
data.body:
Consider the following example

``` python
screen say:
    if p == 'l':
        $ xy = (0.1, 0.5)
    elif p == 'r':
        $ xy = (0.9, 0.5)
    elif p == 'c':
        $ xy = (0.5, 0.5)
    window:
        vbox:
            area (0, 0, 150, 100)
            align xy
            text who id 'who' ypos -0.5
            text what id 'what'

define el = Character('Eileen', show_p='l')
define er = Character('Eileen', show_p='r')
define ec = Character('Eileen', show_p='c')

label start:
    el "Left"
    er "Right"
    ec "Center"
```

All the 'say' dialogues will be in the top left corner

data.title: Changes audio.py to work around an indefinite lockup that occurs if you try to quit while PulseAudio is locked.
data.body:
To replicate the lockup:

startx as two different users.
Do something that locks the sound card as user1 (say, playing a pile of mp3s
through mpg321)
As the other user, start and then quit a Ren'Py game.

Result: strace will show the Ren'Py game sitting there waiting indefinitely
for a futex until such time as mpg321 releases the sound card.

data.title: high resolution games on android
data.body:
Some notes on attempting to get a 4K resolution game running on Android devices.

Test game is in 3840x2160 resolution.  Game is also running with config.image_cache_size = 32.  Game in this resolution is proprietary and unfortunately can not be posted.

Devices tested were NVidia Shield (2GB RAM), and OnePlus One (3GB RAM).  Want to test on Samsung Galaxy S, none yet available.

Shield device crashed during playback. OnePlus made it farther on first run-through [with some odd artifacting](http://imgur.com/a/cK037) but crashed on subsequent tests.

data.title: Function() action does not update screen
data.body:
I realize this is perhaps not a bug per se, but i think most cases of Function() usage require updating screen. I found myself writing `renpy.restart_interaction()` on every function called through Function action and so wrote a simple wrapper that does it for me:

``` python
class UFunction(Action):
    "Like Function, but make sure to update screen"
    def __init__(self, f, *args, **kw_args):
        super(UFunction, self).__init__()
        self.f = Function(f, *args, **kw_args)
    def __call__(self):
        r = self.f.__call__()
        renpy.restart_interaction()
        return r
```

Are there any usecases when this wouldn't be preferred behaviour? (perhaps some performance concerns?)

Since it's pretty universal to call function which changes screen state, i would suggest either adding separate action analogous to UFunction or add restart_interaction call directly to Function.

data.title: Building documentation doesn't describe how to build full Ren'Py capable of making distributions
data.body: Or, in other words, there's no instructions (or they are hidden too deep) for building contents of lib/ directory.

data.title: add missing parentheses in setuplib.py and remove old README
data.body:
"if not android or ios:" <- this line has redundant "or ios" part, so either it was meant to be "not (android or ios)" or just "not android".. Not sure if this affects anything, but it's better to keep source clean.

Also removed outdated README in module/ directory.

data.title: New archive.rpa fails to overwrite old after 6.18 Windows executable downloads 6.99-built update
data.body:
I updated our game's Ren'Py 6.18 build to it's most recent version built in Ren'Py 6.99. After the game restarts after update, the game's appearance didn't change as if the update didn't succeed. Checked updates again, and the screen says it's "up to date." Inspected the [game] folder and I found two RPA files: the old archive.rpa and an archive.rpa.new that's more than twice as big as the old one. 

![20150607](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2226326/8020771/e4742cfc-0cb7-11e5-9db1-cccf4862994b.png)

Deleting the old archive.rpa and renaming the new one seems to do the trick, but I think the updater should do this by itself.

data.title: Use dill for saving
data.body:
This allows to save things which are impossible with regular pickle/cPickle, including cases which are pickled fine in py3, but can't be pickled by py2 pickle. [Dill](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/dill) seems to have no effect with cPickle, but as long as there's long-term plan to migrate to py3 this shouldn't be a problem.

I don't know what is correct way to add dependency (i just installed dill using 'pip install dill' in virtual env, but perhaps there's a way to automatize this?), but if you're going to accept this, i can either put that into README or do proper dependency if you tell me where to look.

data.title: IndexError
data.body:

While running game code:
  File "game/chap1_theregalninth.rpy", line 223, in script
    sel""
IndexError: list index out of range

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/chap1_theregalninth.rpy", line 223, in script
    sel""
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\ast.py", line 593, in execute
    renpy.exports.say(who, what, interact=self.interact)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\exports.py", line 1021, in say
    who(what, interact=interact)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\character.py", line 826, in **call**
    self.do_display(who, what, cb_args=self.cb_args, *_display_args)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\character.py", line 688, in do_display
    *_display_args)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\character.py", line 491, in display_say
    rv = renpy.ui.interact(mouse='say', type=type, roll_forward=roll_forward)

    rv = renpy.game.interface.interact(roll_forward=roll_forward, *_kwargs)

    rv = root_widget.event(ev, x, y, 0)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\display\layout.py", line 864, in event

    rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)

data.title: Transform problem
data.body:
```
$ renpy.layer_at_list([Transform()])
show test01:
    easein 1.0 yoffset -10
'A'
$ renpy.layer_at_list([Transform()])
'B'
```

In v6.99.3.404, test01 doesn't move in 'B'.
But in 6.99.4.438, test01 move in 'B'.

data.body:

```
File "launcher/game/new_project.rpy", line 126, in script call

error: subsurface rectangle outside surface area.
```

data.title: Reserved name warnings.
